metadata.title: CVE-2020-6810 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: After a website had entered fullscreen mode, it could have used a previously opened popup to obscure the notification that indicates the browser is in fullscreen mode. Combined with spoofing the browser chrome, this could have led to confusing the user about the current origin of the page and credential theft or other attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 74.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
